solution.text:
Since the system allows heat to flow in, it must have thermally conductive walls. Since it is a closed system, the internal energy is given by the formula:
\(\Delta U = q + w \).\(\implies \Delta U = q + 0 \).\(\implies \Delta U = q\).

content.text: Express the following statement as a formula - 'No work is done on the closed system, but q amount of heat is added to the system from the surroundings.' What type of wall does the system have?
